message.content:
cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.HC

This paper deals with methods of segmenting and visualizing presentation videos by separately considering audio and visual data. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) and Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories. The paper also involves segmentation of the video track by visual dissimilarities, which suggests that it may also belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses an Automatic Speech Recognizer (ASR) to extract key phrases from the audio track, which indicates that it may belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. Finally, the paper presents an interactive user interface, which suggests that it may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
